title: Louisville Remembers A Tumultuous Time 60 Years Ago
teaser: A touchstone event in the civil rights era began when white activists purchased a home on behalf of a young black family.
contentencoded:
This year, Louisville, Kentucky, has been marking the anniversary of a touchstone event in the civil rights era. It started 60 years ago when white activists, led by Carl and Anne Braden purchased a home on behalf of a young black family.

As Rick Howlett of Here & Now contributing station WFPL reports, that act touched off weeks of racial violence.
